result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gleris Pineda Martinez

records.addlTxt:
for NGI Examination
ec: DA, Atty De La Rosa, WFU ae 11/4/22
Proposed NGI Exam Order
Status conference on February 2, 2023 at 10:00 am.

[ma] Case called at 8:46am
Defendant Gleris Pineda Martinez in court.  Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa in court for Gleris Pineda Martinez.  Attorney Krysta Parson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Sylvie Dahnert sworn as Spanish Interpreter for the Defendant. 

Ms. Pineda waives her right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds her over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty and not guilty by reason of mental disease/defect" entered

The Court finds that the Defendant has entered a plea of NGI and there is reason to believe mental disease/defect will become an issue.
The Court orders Defendant to be examined. 
The Court directs exam be conducted by Wisconsin Forensic Unit.
The examiner shall submit a report to the court no later than 1/3/23. 

The Court directs Atty De La Rosa to draft order. 
recess:8:57am 

NEXT: (1)Pretrial to be conducted informally after receipt of report (2)Status Conference on 2/2/23 at 10:00am
Preliminary hearing on November 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

[ma] Case called at 8:41 AM 
Defendant Gleris Pineda Martinez in court.  Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa in court for Gleris Pineda Martinez.  Attorney Jeffrey Martin Shock in court for State of Wisconsin. 
James Larson sworn as Spanish Interpreter for the Defendant. 

Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.

recess: 8:43am 
NEXT: Preliminary Hearing on 11/1/22 at 8:30am

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Att De La Rosa
Status conference on October 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

[MK] case called at 8:34am 
Defendant Gleris Pineda Martinez in court. DA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
Shawna Stevenoski is sworn as Spanish Interpreter. 
The Court summarizes the information provided by the Public Defenders Office regarding their efforts to appoint a Spanish-speaking attorney for Ms. Pineda Martinez. The Court directs that the PD appoint an English speaking only attorney if that is the best they can do. 
recess 8:38am 

NEXT:  Status Conference (status of counsel hearing) on October 17th at 8:30am
Status of Counsel
Status conference on August 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

[ml] Case called at 8:40AM
Defendant Gleris Pineda Martinez in court. ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Spanish Interpreter Shawna Stevenoski sworn in.

The Court notes that it has a letter from the Public Defender's Office stating that the Defendant is eligible, but the office has yet appoint counsel.
The Court sets this matter over so that the Court may attempt to find a Spanish speaking attorney for the Defendant. The Court expects that there will be an attorney appointed that can serve the Defendant at the next hearing.
The Court notes that there will be no repayment plan for the Defendant.

recess 8:45AM

NEXT: 
(1) Appointment of Spanish speaking counsel for the Defendant without a repayment requirement
(2) Status Conference (also Status of Counsel) on 08/08 at 8:30AM with in person appearances
Status of Counsel
Scheduling Order

Pre-trial conference on June 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on June 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Bond Document rec'd from JESO on 5/9/22
Order to Seal Victim Key

Conditions of this bond include:
--no acts or threats of violence toward any person

[ml] Case called a 1:25PM
Defendant Gleris Pineda Martinez appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Kayla Barteck. Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient by counsel agreement. 
Spanish Interpreter Elizabeth Barrera sworn in.

The Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
Preliminary Hearing time limit is waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $750.00 Signature Bond with conditions:
--no acts or threats of violence toward any person

recess 1:34PM

NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 06/01 at 10:00AM with in counsel appearances only  (2) Status Conference on 06/03 at 8;30AM with in person appearances
